newsitem.title: UK: Watmoughs sells SMK interest to Christies.
newsitem.headline: Watmoughs sells SMK interest to Christies.

text.p: British printing group Watmoughs (Holdings) Plc said on Thursday it had agreed to sell its 50 percent investment in Studio SMK to Christies International Plc for a total 2.46 million stg.
Studio SMK, engaged solely in pre-press systems involved in the production of Christies' auction catalogues, now becomes a wholly owned unit of Christies, which already held the other 50 percent.

Watmoughs also said it disposed today of its holding of three million Christie shares at 295 pence per share, for a total consideration of 8.85 million stg and an exceptional profit of 5.01 million stg.
Watmoughs said in a statement that close co-operation between the two companies would continue.
